sources.name: Share of land used as permanent meadows and pastures- FAOstat
sources.description:
Data published by United Nations Food and Agricultural Organization (FAOstat)
Data publisher's source FAO questionaires, estimates and national publications
Link http://www.fao.org/faostat/en/#home
Retrieved 2017-07-24

Permanent meadows and pastures is defined by the FAO as: "the land used permanently (five years or more) to grow herbaceous forage crops, either cultivated or growing wild (wild prairie or grazing land)."

Data here is presented as the share of total land area (with the exclusion of area covered by freshwater bodies) used for permanent meadows and pasture.

variables.name: Permanent meadows and pastures
variables.description: Share of land used as permanent meadows and pastures
